segments.text: <speak>Welcome to this demonstration of <emphasis level='moderate'>circle</emphasis> properties.<break time='500ms'/></speak>
<speak>Let's start by creating a <emphasis level='moderate'>circle</emphasis> with <emphasis level='moderate'>radius</emphasis> 2.<break time='500ms'/></speak>

<speak>The center of a <emphasis level='moderate'>circle</emphasis> is the point from which all points on the <emphasis level='moderate'>circle</emphasis> are equidistant.<break time='500ms'/></speak>
<speak>The <emphasis level='moderate'>radius</emphasis> is the distance from the center to any point on the <emphasis level='moderate'>circle</emphasis>.<break time='500ms'/></speak>
<speak>The <emphasis level='moderate'>diameter</emphasis> is twice the <emphasis level='moderate'>radius</emphasis> and passes through the center.<break time='500ms'/></speak>

<speak>The <emphasis level='moderate'>circumference</emphasis> of a <emphasis level='moderate'>circle</emphasis> equals <emphasis level='moderate'>pi</emphasis> times the <emphasis level='moderate'>diameter</emphasis>.<break time='500ms'/></speak>

<speak>The <emphasis level='moderate'>area</emphasis> of a <emphasis level='moderate'>circle</emphasis> equals <emphasis level='moderate'>pi</emphasis> times the <emphasis level='moderate'>radius</emphasis> <emphasis level='moderate'>squared</emphasis>.<break time='500ms'/></speak>
<speak>Understanding these properties is fundamental to mathematics.<break time='500ms'/></speak>
